If you're looking for a thought-provoking and atmospheric film that explores the unknown, I'd recommend "Smilla's Sense of Snow". The movie follows Smilla, a half-Inuit woman, as she delves into the mysterious death of a young boy in Copenhagen. With its blend of mystery, suspense, and cultural intrigue, this film might just satisfy your curiosity!

If you're open to something entirely different, I'd suggest "Man on Wire", which tells the incredible true story of Philippe Petit's daring high-wire walk between the Twin Towers in 1974. It's a thrilling and visually stunning documentary that will leave you breathless!
